text: (chopping sound, bouncy music)
Hi everybody!
This morning I feel like making a nice breakfast.
Something that goes down very smoothly.

And mild. Something that 
I can digest very well.

So I'm making porridge. 
We are going to make saeu-juk.
I got some really fresh shrimp

I shelled the shrimp and 
then cut all along the back
and then if you find a long black line
this is the intestinal track, and we have to remove this.
This is 8oz of cleaned shrimp.
I'm soaking my rice in cold water.
One hour ago I started soaking.

One cup short grain rice, and 
rinse this a couple of times

drain and soak in cold water.
That's it!

Let's smash garlic!
(smashing sound)

(chopping sound)
I use 2 large garlic cloves
And onion,
Around half cup onion.
I like to finish all cutting jobs.
So carrot, this is already peeled.
I need around a half cup.
Transfer this here.
4 green onion
Chop it up.
And then shrimp!

So now I'm going inside to 
quickly wash my hands.

I'm using a little bit of 
carrot and green onion
but these are optional.

If you are really busy and you want to 
make a quick shrimp porridge
then just garlic and onion and shrimp

That's all you need,
these things.

But I like to make it a little bit colorful
so I use this.

Of course it's a little - little! - more delicious
(laughs)
Now let's heat it up.
I'm cooking outdoors.
So I'm going to use this wind protection.
This is the sesame oil I brought.

And sesame oil always 
means toasted sesame oil.
So one tablespoon.
And then garlic and onion.
Wow smells good!
This rice, let's drain the water.

I stir fried 2 minutes, and then
add rice

When you make porridge, 
any kind of porridge

use a large pot, because when 
this is boiling it's easily boiling over.

I stir fried this rice 
around 2 or 3 minutes

and then this rice is a little bit sticky
and there is no water on the bottom
and look a little cooked.
And then add shrimp.
Wow lots of shrimp.

The more shrimp we use, 
the taste is more savory.
Wow, looks great!
The shrimp is around half cooked.
And then, carrot.
I will add water now.
8 cups.

Cover.
I'm going to cook around 20 minutes.
Over medium high heat.
(birds singing)
(waves crashing)

The sun is coming up
so I have to wear my sunglasses

You know, the weather at the beach
is always changeable.

Today's weather is very changeable.
(laughs)

So around 10 minutes after, 
it's really boiling with bubbling.

So you need to keep an eye on this.
I said 20 minutes cooking over medium high heat

"Ok Maangchi said 20 minutes,
I can go do my work."

Don't do that, keep an eye on this
because any minute it will boil over.

So when this is boiling over,
just stir this with your ladle.
And half cover.

I like to add some eggs.
So I want to add 2 eggs.
Beat the eggs...

So 20 minutes after,
the rice is cooked.

But we need to cook more,
so I like to turn down the heat to low.
And I'm cooking around 10 minutes more.
(bird chirping)

Really really good!
Some times you have to stir this now

so that it's not going to 
be burnt on the bottom.

Nice, huh? 
Nice consistency.

These toasted sesame seeds,
I'm going to grind a little bit.

Nice. You don't have to grind really finely.
That's enough.

10 minutes passed!
Green onion first.
And egg.

Before adding egg,
first one more time stir this.

So that the bottom is 
not going to be burnt.
Sticky. Ok...

Nice!
So, egg.

So don't stir.
Let it cook for one minute.

And I'm going to add this salty stuff.
Fish sauce.
2 tablespoons.
Like this.
Gorgeous, isn't it?

Saeu-juk is done.
I'm going to turn off.
Nice. I'm so happy
Because I can cook outdoors like this!
I love my wind protector.

Amazing! 
Without this I can't cook.

(laughs) 
I don't need any other side dishes.
I just brought some kimchi.

And some kimchi and saeu-juk, 
that's it!

Like this.
Also the small one.
And a lot of left overs.
And then -- wow windy! (laughs)

This is gim-garu, toasted and 
crushed gim, seaweed paper.

I toasted my gim on the stove,
put it in a plastic bag and crushed it.

So this one is very nice. Whenever I
make this porridge, I need to make this.
So I'm going to add this...

Wow windy windy!
Oh my God! (laughs)
And sesame seeds...

Wonderful time!
Time to eat!

Cheers everybody!
(laughs)
Mmm!

So delicious. And savory,
and shrimpy! (laughs)

I think this is more delicious 
because just I cook right here

And then eating outside of my home.
What could be better!
So today we made saeu-juk.

Shrimp porridge.
Enjoy my recipe.
See you next time, bye!
